info.description: API offers the following services : Initiation and update of a payment request and Status information of a payment. Variants of Payment Initiation Requests : Payment products - sepa-credit-transfers, instant-sepa-credit-transfers, target-2-payments and cross-border-credit-transfers. Furthermore request depends on the Payment services - payments, bulk-payments and periodic-payments
info.title: PSD II Payment services

post.description: API to update Payment Resource information. This mainly updates the various status of the payment request anytime during its lifecycle. The API shall be linked to  the  'Update PSU data for payment initiation and Update PSU Data for payment initiation cancellation' published API in accordance with the Open Banking norms to update the resource record.

parameters.description: Indicates the unique reference number of the payment

parameters.description: body Payload

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

get.summary: Retrieves details of a Payment Request
get.description: API to retrieve information of a Payment request of different Payment Products when a reference is queried. This information includes: 1. Debtor's Name,Account, IBAN, Currency, Available Balance, Address  2. Creditor's Name,Account,Currency, Remittance information  3. Transaction Value date, Start and End date incase or recurring payment, Frequency, Exchange Rate  4. Charge type, code and currency involved 5. Commission amount and Currency involved  6. Tax Amount and Currency  7. Transaction Status, SCA Status, TPP reference.  The API shall be linked to the 'Get Payment Information and Payment initiation status request' published API in accordance with the Open Banking norms to fetch Payment Details.

get.description: API to retrieve the subresource information of a particular payment request. The information retrieved includes the Payment Type, current and subsequent Subresource reference, SCA Status and Flow.   This API shall be used by 'get Authorisations', 'get SCA Status of payment authorisations', 'get SCA status of payment cancellations' and 'getcancellations' published APIs in accordance to open banking standards to get the status details.

parameters.name: paymentId
parameters.description: Indicates the unique reference number of the payment

parameters.name: subResourceType
parameters.description: Indicates if the sub resource is created for authorization or cancellation of the PSD2 payment. Can contain values 'AUTH' or 'CANC' which indicates authorization and cancellation respectively.

parameters.name: subResourceId
parameters.description: Contains the sub resource identifier which is constructed of the payment Id, status of the payment and sequence number during authorisation or deletion of a payment. Applies to both implicit & explicit payment workflows. For example: FT0003003-AUTH-1

code.description: The code related to override message.

responseCode.description: The user input to accept/reject the override.

subResourceId.description: Contains the sub resource identifier which is constructed of the payment Id, status of the payment and sequence number during authorisation or deletion of a payment. Applies to both implicit & explicit payment workflows. For example: FT0003003-AUTH-1

subResourceScaStatus.description: Contains the SCA(Strong Customer Authentication) status of a sub resource linked to a payment transaction. For example: received,started,finalised,exempted,psuIdentified etc.

subResourceCaptureMethod.description: Specifies whether the payment was automatically created by the system (AUTO / Implicit) or based on a TPP (third party provider) request (TPP / Explicit)

subResourceRequestId.description: Specifes if the sub-resource is created by a TPP (third party provider), this contains the incoming X-Request-ID which created it.

globalURN.description: globalURNSpecifies the GLOBAL.URN reference of the TPP (third party provider). This will be retrieved from the request and should match a GLOBAL.URN from a record within the Open Banking Directory.

thirdPartyProvider.description: Contains the TPP (third party provider) name or text of the TPP reference

scaHint.description: Specifies whether the SCA (strong customer authentication) is required or not. For example: scaRequired, scaNotRequired.

paymentStatus.description: Describes the current status of the payment order in the payment system

scaStatus.description: Contains the status of the strong customer authentication process for the payment or consent. Valid values are received, psuIdentified, scaMethodSelected, started, finalised or failed

defaultRedirectURL.description: Default redirection URL provided by the TPP (third party provider).

failureRedirectURL.description: Contains the default redirection URL provided by the TPP (third party provider) for a failed or cancelled payment in the case where TPP specifies different URLs for different payment outcomes.

externalPaymentStatus.description: Status of the payment when the payment processing system is external

externalStatusReason.description: Status reason of the payment when the payment processing system is external

trustedBeneficiary.description: Indicator to determine whether the credit account number belongs to one of the customer's trusted beneficiaries. Contains TRUE/FALSE.

scaExempt.description: Indicates actual SCA(Strong Customer Authentication) status of the payment. Possible values YES or NO.

authorisationKey.description: Holds SCA authorisation for the corresponding payment

certificate.description: Holds corresponding certificate for authorisation key

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique identifier/Message Reference of the record created.

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

debitAccountId.description: Indicates the debit account number of the payment or transaction.

beneficiaryName.description: Short title or short name of the beneficiary

beneficiaryAccountId.description: Unique account identifier of the beneficiary account number.

beneficiaryIBAN.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the beneficiary account, required only for International transfers/payments outside the Bank. For example: GB98 MIDL07009312345678, FR7630006000011234567890189

beneficiaryAddressLine1.description: Address of the beneficiary or credit account.

beneficiaryCountryId.description: Country of the beneficiary account number. For example: US, IN, EU

beneficiaryAddressCity.description: City of the beneficiary account. For example: London, Dallas etc.

creditorAgentBIC.description: BIC(Business Identifier Code) code used by an agent in a payment transaction. The BIC consists of 8 or 11 alphanumeric characters, comprising a Business party prefix (previous institution code), country code, business party suffix and branch identifier. The BIC Code structure is defined by the international standard under ISO 9362:2014 and country code ISO 3166-1. BIC Codes Examples: BARCGB22XXX or DEUTDEFFXXX or BNPAFRPPXXX

creditorAgentNationalCode.description: National code of the creditor account. For example: EU, US etc.

remittanceInformation.description: Indicates the remittance information that is supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form.

creditReference.description: Reference quoted by the credit account for a payment

paymentDetail.description: Indicates the payment details for the beneficiary to apply the payment.

chargeBearer.description: Bearer of the charges of the order. For example: BEN(All transaction charges are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.), OUR(All transaction charges are to be borne by the ordering customer.), SHA(Transaction charges on the Sender's side are to be borne by the ordering customer, transaction charges on the Receiver's side are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.)

creditCurrencyId.description: Specifies the credit currency. For example: USD, EUR etc.

creditAmount.description: Amount to be credited in a payment transaction

executionDate.description: Date on which the transaction or payment gets processed, i.e. the processing date of the transaction.

debitReference.description: Reference for debit party of a payment transaction

debitAccountId.description: Indicates the debit account number of the payment or transaction.

page_token.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request

debtorReference.description: Reference number for the debit side of the transaction.

debitAccountId.description: Indicates the debit account number of the payment or transaction.

debitAmount.description: Amount to be debited in a payment transaction

debitAccountIBAN.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the debtor account, required only for International transfers/payments outside the Bank. For example: GB98 MIDL07009312345678, FR7630006000011234567890189

debitCurrency.description: Currency of the debit account. For example: USD, EUR etc.

payoutSortCode.description: Contains the bank sort code or iban branch identifier for the settlement account

availableBalance.description: Available balance of the account which is the projected balance which includes the net movements of both debits and credits against the account.

creditorName.description: Name or short title of the credit account

creditAccountId.description: Credit account identifier of the payment or transaction

creditAmount.description: Amount to be credited in a payment transaction

creditCurrency.description: Currency of the account which funds will be transferred to.

payInSortCode.description: Contains the bank sort code or iban branch identifier for the credit account

street.description: Contains the first line of customer's base address, example building number, street number etc.

addressDetail.description: Additional address information, e.g. Contact Person. Building, Floor, Apartment, Street Number, Street Name, Town, Area, Code

city.description: City address stated on driver licence or utlility bill. For example London, New York etc.

postCode.description: Identifies the address postal code for the customer.

country.description: Identifies the country of the customer.

debitValueDate.description: Date on which the amount will be debited for settlement

creditValueDate.description: Reference quoted by the credit account for a payment

executionDate.description: Date on which the transaction or payment gets processed, i.e. the processing date of the transaction.

currentFrequency.description: Indicates the current frequency of the standing order

currentEndDate.description: Identifies the current end date of the standing order for the currency, amount and frequency specified. When the bank has received from the customer clear instructions which stipulate that the standing order must  only be executed during a determined period of time.  This is the date of the last execution of the standing order or when the customer has requested the bank to pay a certain amount during a determined period of time and then another amount starting from that date. In this case, this field specifies the end date of the first standing order amount.  After that date the second amount will then be executed.

description.description: Contains the description of purpose of the payment.

exchangeRate.description: Contains the exchange rate returned from the system. i.e. For entries over foreign currency accounts, this contains the rate which used to convert the currency amount to the local equivalent at the time of the originating transaction.

chargeAmount.description: Retrieves the Charge Amount after redeem

chargeCurrency.description: Indicates the currency code of the charge account from where the fee is deducted

beneficiaryOurCharges.description: Indicates the bearer of the charges. For example: BEN( All transaction charges are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.), OUR (All transaction charges are to be borne by the ordering customer.), SHA (Transaction charges on the Sender's side are to be borne by the ordering customer, transaction charges on the Receiver's side are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.)

chargeCode.description: Indicates the charge code to which the charges are identified and calculated and to be debited to the customer account. For example: C(Credit less Charges The Credit less Charges), D(Debit plus Charge The Debit plus Charge) , W(Waive).

chargeType.description: Indicates the charge types which are applicable for the transaction. Example: CORRBKCHG

commissionAmount.description: Amount of commission charged for the payment created with respect to the commission type used.

commissionCurrency.description: Currency of the account from which commission is deducted. For example: USD, EUR, GBP etc.

taxAmount.description: Total amount of taxes applicable on all commission or charges calculated for the transaction/payment.

taxCurrency.description: Contains the currency that tax is to be levied in. Example USD, GBP etc.

remittanceInformation.description: Indicates the remittance information that is supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form.

trustedBeneficiary.description: Indicator to determine whether the credit account number belongs to one of the customer's trusted beneficiaries. Contains TRUE/FALSE.

paymentStatus.description: Describes the current status of the payment order in the payment system

scaStatus.description: Contains the status of the strong customer authentication process for the payment or consent. Valid values are received, psuIdentified, scaMethodSelected, started, finalised or failed

transactionType.description: Identifies the transaction type applicable to the transaction being processed, i.e. outward or inward payment. For example: ACPX, OTPX etc.

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

frequency.description: Specifies the frequency in which the payment application(periodic payments) execute the payment instruction.

tppName.description: Indicates the name of the third party provider.

debtorName.description: Contains the name of the debtor.

paymentOrderId.description: The unique reference number of payment

singleOrmultiplePayments.description: Indicates the batch booking preference of the bulk payment. SINGLE  Single consolidated accounting entry on the debtor account. MULTI  Individual postings per each credit entry

batchBookingPreferred.description: Indicates the batch booking preference of the bulk payment. SINGLE  Single consolidated accounting entry on the debtor account. MULTI  Individual postings per each credit entry

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

code.description: The identifier of the error message
The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message for bad requests

type.description: The identifier of error type: Business

code.description: The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message caused by server

type.description: The identifier of error type: System

subResourceId.description: Contains the sub resource identifier which is constructed of the payment Id, status of the payment and sequence number during authorisation or deletion of a payment. Applies to both implicit & explicit payment workflows. For example: FT0003003-AUTH-1

subResourceType.description: Indicates if the sub resource is created for authorization or cancellation of the PSD2 payment. Can contain values 'AUTH' or 'CANC' which indicates authorization and cancellation respectively.

scaStatus.description: Contains the status of the strong customer authentication process for the payment or consent. Valid values are received, psuIdentified, scaMethodSelected, started, finalised or failed

nextSubResourceId.description: Indicates the next sub resource that can be used for authorisation or cancellation of the payment. Example: For a Funds transfer payment FT1234567, if the utilised sub resource Id for authorisation of the FT is FT1234567-AUTH-1, the next sub resource Id for authorisation of the FT would be FT1234567-AUTH-2

scaFlow.description: Indicates the strong customer authentication (SCA) flow. Specifies if the PSD2 payment follows implicit or explicit approach

singleOrmultiplePayments.description: Indicates the batch booking preference of the bulk payment. SINGLE  Single consolidated accounting entry on the debtor account. MULTI  Individual postings per each credit entry

processingDate.description: The date when payment instruction is processed in system.

bulkReference.description: Contains bulk master reference for the payment.

bulkTypeId.description: Identifier of the bulk update type record that holds default conditions required for Bulk Master creation. SINGLE and MULTI are two record references used by payment order application for processing payments induced through Bulk Master.

singleOrmultiplePayments.description: Indicates the batch booking preference of the bulk payment. SINGLE  Single consolidated accounting entry on the debtor account. MULTI  Individual postings per each credit entry

processingDate.description: The date when payment instruction is processed in system.

bulkReference.description: Contains bulk master reference for the payment.

creditOrDebitPayment.description: Indicates whether the Bulk processing is for Credit or Debit Payments. Allowed values are DEBIT, CREDIT.

cancelReason.description: Contains the reason for which the payment is cancelled.

cancelInitiatedBy.description: Contains the party initiating the payment cancellation. Examples are BANK or CUSTOMER.

cancelRemark.description: Contains the remarks given for cancellation.

The BIC Code structure is defined by the international standard under ISO 9362:2014 and country code ISO 3166-1. BIC Codes Examples: BARCGB22XXX or DEUTDEFFXXX or BNPAFRPPXXX

accountWithBankBIC.description: This is the BIC code of the institution where beneficiary holds an account

accountWithBankIBAN.description: This is the IBAN of the institution where beneficiary holds an account

accountWithBankClearingCode.description: This is the national clearing code or sort code of the institution where beneficiary holds an account

creditorAgentCountryId.description: The country of the beneficiary institution i.e. where the final creditor holds an account

transactionAmount.description: Contains the transaction amount. This is based on the currency, either local or foreign currency

paymentCurrency.description: This field holds the transaction currency or currency in which payment is initiated.

executionDate.description: Date on which the transaction or payment gets processed, i.e. the processing date of the transaction.

instructionIdReference.description: Indicates the SEPA purpose of the SEPA Payment

endToEndReference.description: Indicates the end to end reference for the payment. This field can be provided by the person who instructs the payment and this flows through the lifecycle of the payment.

paymentProduct.description: Preferred payment product can be specified for Beneficiary. This will be used for defaulting the payment product for specific beneficiary.

chargeBearer.description: Bearer of the charges of the order. For example: BEN(All transaction charges are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.), OUR(All transaction charges are to be borne by the ordering customer.), SHA(Transaction charges on the Sender's side are to be borne by the ordering customer, transaction charges on the Receiver's side are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.)

cutOffTime.description: The Cut off time when all executions for the day are consolidated to create a trade

PSDCompliant.description: Defines whether the transaction is PSD (Payment Services Directive) compliant or not.

simulatedAt.description: Time when payment transaction was simulated

simulationChecked.description: Indicates if simulation is performed for the payment order

creditValueDate.description: Reference quoted by the credit account for a payment

orderingPaymentFxCustomerRate.description: The customer rate for the conversion between payment currency and ordering currency

totalDebitAmount.description: The total debit amount including the charges associated for the payment

ultimateDebtor.description: Contains the actual debitor account number

ultimateCreditor.description: Contains the actual creditor account number

purpose.description: Purpose identifier of the payment or transaction, for SEPA payments in general.

structuredCreditorReference.description: Contains description of the credit account reference

creditorAddress.description: Address of the creditor or beneficiary account

bulkReference.description: Contains bulk master reference for the payment.

singleOrmultiplePayments.description: Indicates the batch booking preference of the bulk payment. SINGLE  Single consolidated accounting entry on the debtor account. MULTI  Individual postings per each credit entry

beneficiarySWIFTAddress.description: Address of the beneficiary which will be included as part of outgoing payment instruction

beneficiaryAddressLine1.description: Address of the beneficiary or credit account.

remittanceInformation.description: Indicates the remittance information that is supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form.

contextName.description: Field name returned by the payment engine (TPH) for information or further processing.

contextValue.description: Field value returned by the payment engine (TPH) for information or further processing.

chargeAccountId.description: Indicates the account to which the charges has to be levied. Used when charges are to be taken from a separate account

chargeAccountCurrencyId.description: When a charge account is specified, this field indicates the currency of the charge account

chargeType.description: Indicates the charge types which are applicable for the transaction. Example: CORRBKCHG

chargeName.description: The description of the charge to be taken for payment

chargeCurrency.description: Indicates the currency code of the charge account from where the fee is deducted

chargeAmount.description: Retrieves the Charge Amount after redeem

debitAccountId.description: Indicates the debit account number of the payment or transaction.

debitAccountIBAN.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the debtor account, required only for International transfers/payments outside the Bank. For example: GB98 MIDL07009312345678, FR7630006000011234567890189

creditorName.description: Name or short title of the credit account

creditAccountId.description: Credit account identifier of the payment or transaction

beneficiaryIBAN.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the beneficiary account, required only for International transfers/payments outside the Bank. For example: GB98 MIDL07009312345678, FR7630006000011234567890189

creditorAddresses.description: Address of the creditor or beneficiary account

creditorAddress.description: Address of the creditor or beneficiary account

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

instructedAmount.description: Specifies the amount which is allocated or instructed for the account reference included in the selection for a specific transaction.

currentFrequencyDate.description: Indicates the date based on current frequency

dateAdjustment.description: Defines the behavior when recurring payment dates falls on a weekend or bank holiday. The payment is then executed either the 'preceding' or 'following' working day. ASPSP might reject the request due to the communicated value, if rules in Online-Banking are not supporting this execution rule.

currentEndDate.description: Identifies the current end date of the standing order for the currency, amount and frequency specified. When the bank has received from the customer clear instructions which stipulate that the standing order must  only be executed during a determined period of time.  This is the date of the last execution of the standing order or when the customer has requested the bank to pay a certain amount during a determined period of time and then another amount starting from that date. In this case, this field specifies the end date of the first standing order amount.  After that date the second amount will then be executed.

paymentDetail.description: Indicates the payment details for the beneficiary to apply the payment.

currentEndDate.description: Identifies the current end date of the standing order for the currency, amount and frequency specified. When the bank has received from the customer clear instructions which stipulate that the standing order must  only be executed during a determined period of time.  This is the date of the last execution of the standing order or when the customer has requested the bank to pay a certain amount during a determined period of time and then another amount starting from that date. In this case, this field specifies the end date of the first standing order amount.  After that date the second amount will then be executed.

debitCurrency.description: Currency of the debit account. For example: USD, EUR etc.

currentAmountBalance.description: Indicates the amount of the Standing Order.Incase of Balance Maintenance Standing Order, this field will define the Balance to be maintained in the Account.

beneficiaryOurCharges.description: Indicates the bearer of the charges. For example: BEN( All transaction charges are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.), OUR (All transaction charges are to be borne by the ordering customer.), SHA (Transaction charges on the Sender's side are to be borne by the ordering customer, transaction charges on the Receiver's side are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.)

creditorAddress.description: Address of the creditor or beneficiary account

beneficiaryAddress.description: The address of the Beneficiary if the customer number of the Beneficiary is not known

endToEndReference.description: Indicates the end to end reference for the payment. This field can be provided by the person who instructs the payment and this flows through the lifecycle of the payment.

beneficiaryIBAN.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the beneficiary account, required only for International transfers/payments outside the Bank. For example: GB98 MIDL07009312345678, FR7630006000011234567890189

bic.description: The BIC code of the Beneficiary bank

endToEndReference.description: Indicates the end to end reference for the payment. This field can be provided by the person who instructs the payment and this flows through the lifecycle of the payment.

paymentProduct.description: Preferred payment product can be specified for Beneficiary. This will be used for defaulting the payment product for specific beneficiary.

chargeBearer.description: Bearer of the charges of the order. For example: BEN(All transaction charges are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.), OUR(All transaction charges are to be borne by the ordering customer.), SHA(Transaction charges on the Sender's side are to be borne by the ordering customer, transaction charges on the Receiver's side are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.)

cutOffTime.description: The Cut off time when all executions for the day are consolidated to create a trade

PSDCompliant.description: Defines whether the transaction is PSD (Payment Services Directive) compliant or not.

simulatedAt.description: Time when payment transaction was simulated

simulationChecked.description: Indicates if simulation is performed for the payment order

creditValueDate.description: Reference quoted by the credit account for a payment

orderingPaymentFxCustomerRate.description: The customer rate for the conversion between payment currency and ordering currency

totalDebitAmount.description: The total debit amount including the charges associated for the payment

ultimateDebtor.description: Contains the actual debitor account number

ultimateCreditor.description: Contains the actual creditor account number

purpose.description: Purpose identifier of the payment or transaction, for SEPA payments in general.

structuredCreditorReference.description: Contains description of the credit account reference

creditorAddress.description: Address of the creditor or beneficiary account

preAuthorizationReference.description: Contains the pre authorization reference for manually authorized funds.

beneficiarySWIFTAddress.description: Address of the beneficiary which will be included as part of outgoing payment instruction

beneficiaryAddressLine1.description: Address of the beneficiary or credit account.

remittanceInformation.description: Indicates the remittance information that is supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form.

contextName.description: Field name returned by the payment engine (TPH) for information or further processing.

contextValue.description: Field value returned by the payment engine (TPH) for information or further processing.

chargeAccountId.description: Indicates the account to which the charges has to be levied. Used when charges are to be taken from a separate account

chargeAccountCurrencyId.description: When a charge account is specified, this field indicates the currency of the charge account

chargeType.description: Indicates the charge types which are applicable for the transaction. Example: CORRBKCHG

chargeName.description: The description of the charge to be taken for payment

chargeCurrency.description: Indicates the currency code of the charge account from where the fee is deducted

chargeAmount.description: Retrieves the Charge Amount after redeem

accountType.description: Groups the products based on their type, eg, Checking, Savings, CD etc,.

debitAccountId.description: Indicates the debit account number of the payment or transaction.

debitCurrency.description: Currency of the debit account. For example: USD, EUR etc.

debitAccountIBAN.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the debtor account, required only for International transfers/payments outside the Bank. For example: GB98 MIDL07009312345678, FR7630006000011234567890189

orderingCustomerId.description: Indicates the customer id for the ordering customer

orderingCustomerName.description: Indicates the name of Ordering Customer

creditorName.description: Name or short title of the credit account

creditAccountId.description: Credit account identifier of the payment or transaction

beneficiaryIBAN.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the beneficiary account, required only for International transfers/payments outside the Bank. For example: GB98 MIDL07009312345678, FR7630006000011234567890189

creditorAgentBIC.description: BIC(Business Identifier Code) code used by an agent in a payment transaction. The BIC consists of 8 or 11 alphanumeric characters, comprising a Business party prefix (previous institution code), country code, business party suffix and branch identifier. The BIC Code structure is defined by the international standard under ISO 9362:2014 and country code ISO 3166-1. BIC Codes Examples: BARCGB22XXX or DEUTDEFFXXX or BNPAFRPPXXX

accountWithBankBIC.description: This is the BIC code of the institution where beneficiary holds an account

accountWithBankIBAN.description: This is the IBAN of the institution where beneficiary holds an account

accountWithBankClearingCode.description: This is the national clearing code or sort code of the institution where beneficiary holds an account

creditorAgentCountryId.description: The country of the beneficiary institution i.e. where the final creditor holds an account

transactionAmount.description: Contains the transaction amount. This is based on the currency, either local or foreign currency

paymentCurrency.description: This field holds the transaction currency or currency in which payment is initiated.

executionDate.description: Date on which the transaction or payment gets processed, i.e. the processing date of the transaction.
